metadata.title: CVE-2013-1619 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The TLS implementation in GnuTLS before 2.12.23, 3.0.x before 3.0.28, and3.1.x before 3.1.7 does not properly consider timing side-channel attackson a noncompliant MAC check operation during the processing of malformedCBC padding, which allows remote attackers to conduct distinguishingattacks and plaintext-recovery attacks via statistical analysis of timingdata for crafted packets, a related issue to CVE-2013-0169.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
guile-gnutls - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls30 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.11-2ubuntu1').
